subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Mendel: The Monk Who Discovered Genetics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mendel: The Monk Who Discovered Genetics usable.

hook.text: A monk in a garden, counting peas. Gregor Mendel discovered the laws of heredity. Genetics was born in a monastery.

buildup.text: Mendel was an Augustinian friar who grew 28,000 pea plants. His experiments revealed dominant and recessive traits.

discovery.text: He published in 1866 but was ignored for 34 years. His work was rediscovered in 1900, launching modern genetics.

twist.text: Mendel's monastery gave him time, space, and funding. Without monastic life, genetics might have come much later.

climax.text: A friar created genetics. A priest proposed the Big Bang. Religion built the conditions for science more than we admit.

punchline.text: Genetics was born in a monastery garden. Religion gave science its space.

quiz.question: Who discovered the laws of heredity?
